snippet: Congress and President Obama should be careful about drawing new red lines in the Syria crisis.
abstract: Editorial holds Pres Obama's decision to ask Congress to postpone a vote on military action in Syria was wise; welcomes meeting between Sec of State John Kerry and Russian Foreign Min Sergey Lavrov to get Syria to disclose and surrender its chemical weapons, even while effort may turn out to be a failure; warns Congress and Obama to be careful about setting hard deadlines or drawing any more red lines.
lead_paragraph: Congress and President Obama should be careful about drawing new red lines in the Syria crisis.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
